org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.components.upload

Class MyUploadReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.components.upload.MyUploadReceiver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.wcs.wcslib.vaadin.widget.multifileupload.receiver.UploadReceiver

    public class MyUploadReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.wcs.wcslib.vaadin.widget.multifileupload.receiver.UploadReceiver
    As stated in the Javadoc of IMyUploadReceiver, this implementation strives to replace the original receiver implementation in Vaadin's 'MultiFileUpload' plugin to:
    • Give us more control over the construction of the server-side file.
    • Unbind handling of the uploaded file from Vaadin (not to succumb to request timeout).
    • Give the handler more information about the file. Pass File instead of InputStream.
    • To use server-global implementation of creating temporary files.
    At the same time, doing so is a drawback for future Vaadin or plugin updates. Newer versions (especially the plugin) may not support hacks like these. When (re-)implementing this class, it is advised to consult the original UploadStatePanel implementation.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

    • Method Detail

      • receiveUpload

        public java.io.OutputStream receiveUpload()
        Original implementation, internal creation of temporary files was outsourced, as stated in this class's javadoc. Used to create an output stream to write pieces of uploaded file to.
        Specified by:
        receiveUpload in interface com.wcs.wcslib.vaadin.widget.multifileupload.receiver.UploadReceiver

      • getStream

        public java.io.InputStream getStream()
        • ORIGINAL USE-CASE:
          called to get a stream on the uploaded file and pass it to a UploadFinishedHandler before calling deleteTempFile().
        • OUR USE-CASE:
          this method has to return null to unbind uploaded file handling from Vaadin. The original implementation contains a safety null check and doesn't throw exceptions so it should be fine.
        Specified by:
        getStream in interface com.wcs.wcslib.vaadin.widget.multifileupload.receiver.UploadReceiver

      • deleteTempFile

        public void deleteTempFile()
        • ORIGINAL USE-CASE:
          Called if getStream() returns a non-null stream or when the upload fails.
        • OUR USE-CASE:
          Called by the plugin, when the upload fails.
        Specified by:
        deleteTempFile in interface com.wcs.wcslib.vaadin.widget.multifileupload.receiver.UploadReceiver

      • getUploadedFileHandler

        public java.io.File getUploadedFileHandler()
        The method we are doing all this for. See this class's Javadoc.
